Orange, Silver and Blue line trains continued single tracking between McPherson Square and Federal Center SW due to Thursday’s non-passenger train derailment. Two track service was restored at approximately 7:00 a.m.

A New Carrollton-bound Orange Line train and A Largo Town Center-bound Silver Line train at East Falls Church were delayed due to a 3rd rail power problem. Rail service was temporarily suspended between East Falls Church, West Falls Church and McLean stations as passengers were evacuated from the incident trains. Service was restored with trains single tracking between Ballston, West Falls Church and McLean stations. Passengers experienced significant delays until approximately 11:45 a.m.

A Shady Grove-bound Red Line train at Farragut North fatally struck an individual who intentionally placed himself in the path of the train. The Red Line trains single tracked between Dupont Circle and Judiciary Square until approximately 2:30 p.m. Service was provided about every 20 minutes in each direction during this time. In addition, Blue and Orange line trains to single tracked between Foggy Bottom and McPherson Square for about 30 minutes during this incident to provide additional safety for emergency responders working near a track that connects to the Red Line near McPherson Square.
